03AE4F2D7646464E84EFF7ADCE6541F2.description:
Students explore
local and global issues and
use collaborative
technologies to work with
others to investigate,
develop, and advocate for
solutions.

3666657C3325451BB4F5BA0228D7464D.description:
Students
contribute constructively to
project teams, choosing
various roles and
responsibilities to work
effectively toward a
common goal.

5EA8386C6BCA4084ACEDA7A4C59638CA.description:
Students use
collaborative technologies to
work with others, including
peers, experts and or
community members, to
examine issues and problems
from multiple viewpoints.

29E0D1C03E2B45AA91D96E38BB04FD3D.description:
Students use digital
tools to connect with learners
from a variety of
backgrounds and cultures,
engaging with them in
various ways that broaden
mutual understanding and
learning.

1A0DBBD7132546A29C0CB56B2FEACD1B.description:
Global Collaborator - Students use digital tools to broaden their perspectives and enrich their learning by
collaborating with others and working effectively in teams locally and globally.

901F013970C749248C2D83E489B10AEB.description:
Students publish or
present content that
customizes the message and
medium for their intended
audiences.

6A8A9A05B31A40CA9D2C31FC2A931F20.description:
Students
communicate complex ideas
clearly using various digital
tools to convey the concepts
textually, visually, graphically,
etc.

A95F993F8E234BDAA6E6014B4E0F566D.description:
Students create
original works or responsibly
repurpose or remix digital
resources into new creations.

101C5FDC7A3447AB90B0B32D83A96E1E.description:
Students choose the
appropriate platforms and tools
for meeting the desired
objectives of their creation or
communication.

C281E3636B5B4B46AF7A86E6375EE0B9.description:
Creative Communicator - Students communicate clearly and express themselves creatively for a variety of
purposes using the platforms, tools, styles, formats and digital media appropriate to their goals.

C2E4B9D9BB9C4381849DD268660FDCEA.description:
Students
understand how automation
works and use algorithmic
thinking to develop a
sequence of steps to create
and test automated
solutions.

927B1A3000FB47E090FD7844573DD97A.description:
Students break
problems into component parts,
extract key information, and
develop descriptive models to
understand complex systems
or facilitate problem-solving.

F773A56305CF44288B5D157623CF6EEF.description:
Students collect
data or identify relevant data
sets, use digital tools to
analyze them, and represent
data in various ways to
facilitate problem-solving and
decision-making.

451B1F411A4746A4B1C1DF0F2033C387.description:
Students formulate
problem definitions suited for
technology-assisted methods
such as data analysis, abstract
models, and algorithmic thinking
in exploring and finding
solutions.

B5A15C87A5E14D239810872F67FAB96F.description:
Computational Thinker - Students exhibit a
tolerance for ambiguity,
perseverance and the capacity
to work with open-ended
problems.

94F20B52090A4F888BB1972BC3099A2E.description:
Students exhibit a
tolerance for ambiguity,
perseverance and the capacity
to work with open-ended
problems.

E9CB4C93A38F4F54B32FDF231F562C7A.description:
Students develop,
test and refine prototypes as
part of a cyclical design
process.

B2AC44C812DA4A35B068D4FE75310AB8.description:
Students select and
use digital tools to plan and
manage a design process
that considers design
constraints and calculated
risks.

886BF894106E4F5D9B3EB3E3533DF7D7.description:
Students know
and use a deliberate
design process for
generating ideas, testing
theories, creating
innovative artifacts or
solving authentic problems.

4354E4F102064E499F40FF6727D790C7.description:
Innovative Designer - Students use a variety of technologies within a design process to identify and solve
problems by creating new, useful or imaginative solutions.

969881F4441E413D93536FBB8F725573.description:
Students build
knowledge by actively
exploring real-world issues
and problems, developing
ideas and theories, and
pursuing answers and
solutions.

0B5BA139ABCE42838D60F4423529C96D.description:
Students curate
information from digital resources
using a variety of tools and
methods to create collections of
artifacts that demonstrate
meaningful connections or
conclusions.

20923138BDFC447A9E63E9181A02772F.description:
Students evaluate
the accuracy, perspective,
credibility, and relevance of
information, media, data or
other resources.

2ED5F3A93220491EA2E88FE6D48D5A6F.description:
Students plan and
employ effective research
strategies to locate information
and other resources for their
intellectual and/or creative
pursuits.

1046C2C56B4F4081BD4095E8E2D5B98B.description:
Knowledge Constructor - Students critically curate a variety of resources using digital tools to construct
knowledge, produce creative artifacts, and make meaningful learning experiences for themselves and others.

70496C72930D42C4BB6AF9FDD3A8E147.description:
Students manage
their personal data to
maintain digital privacy and
security, and are aware of
data-collection technology
used to track their navigation
online.

0F201DE7F876485883CE9B9AD1726D2B.description:
Students demonstrate
and advocate for an
understanding of and respect for
the rights and obligations of
using and sharing intellectual
property.

0FDCF43A7E814493B516B6E1DBEF62FA.description:
Students engage in
and advocate for positive,
safe, legal, and ethical
behavior when using
technology, including social
interactions online or when
using networked devices.

5B78F9C187FC487FB7CC40C143DA81F8.description:
Students cultivate and
manage their digital identity and
reputation and are aware of the
permanence of their actions in
the digital world.

7937EEE1EF6C402A9D3B05AEFB018334.description:
Digital Citizen - Students recognize the rights, responsibilities, and opportunities of living, learning, and
working in an interconnected digital world, and they act and model in ways that are safe, legal, and ethical.

908C9F8D349B48A0BF4687E5651045C8.description:
Students choose,
use and troubleshoot current
technologies, and are able to
transfer their knowledge to
explore new technologies.

6F80ECC4917B46F082BC664147D9982E.description:
Students actively use
technology to seek feedback
that informs and improves their
practice and to demonstrate
their learning in a variety of
ways.

7E7BB8F0D4F94EEA9EEEFB2F2E923945.description:
Students build
networks of experts and peers
to customize their learning
environments in ways that
support the learning process
and in accordance with school
policy.

392743858AD14501A6A66052383100C8.description:
Students articulate
and set personal learning
goals, develop strategies
leveraging technology to
achieve them, and reflect on
the learning process itself to
improve learning outcomes.

1036002E6AD34CBF9582062491729F5E.description:
Empowered Learner - Students leverage technology to take an active role in choosing, achieving, and
demonstrating competency in their learning goals, informed by the learning sciences.
